sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均表示"努力"之意。
means: effort ： 通常指完成某特定任务所需付出的或大或小的努力，可指一次的努力，也可指坚持不懈的努力。
trouble和pains均侧重在面临困难或阻力时所作的努力，但强调在努力时的细心和谨慎，相比之下，pains更适合表示尽力的努力。
endeavour ： 指持久的，坚持不懈的，甚至是终身的努力，强调努力的认真与决心。
struggle ： 指为克服困难或阻力所作的努力，也指因决心、意志或干劲而产生的极大努力。

entry.def: If you make an effort to do something, you try very hard to do it.

example.ex: He made no effort to hide his disappointment...
Finding a cure requires considerable time and effort.
example.tran: 找到治疗的办法需要大量的时间和精力。

entry.def: If you say that someone did something with effort or with an effort, you mean it was difficult for them to do.

example.ex: She took a deep breath and sat up slowly and with great effort...
example.tran: 她深吸一口气，费力地慢慢坐起身来。

example.ex: With an effort she contained her irritation.

entry.def: An effort is a particular series of activities that is organized by a group of people in order to achieve something.
entry.tran: （为达到某一目的的）有组织的行动，一系列活动

example.tran: 在安哥拉进行的饥荒救济行动

entry.def: If you say that something is an effort, you mean that an unusual amount of physical or mental energy is needed to do it.
entry.tran: 费力的事;困难的事;劳神的事

example.ex: Even carrying the camcorder while hiking in the forest was an effort.
example.tran: 在森林中徒步旅行时，即便带的是便携式摄像机也非常费力。

entry.def: If you make the effort to do something, you do it, even though you need extra energy to do it or you do not really want to.

example.ex: I don't get lonely now because I make the effort to see people.
example.tran: 我现在不觉得孤独了，因为我尝试着与人交往。

entry.def: If you do something difficult or painful by an effort of will, you manage to make yourself do it.

example.ex: It was only by a supreme effort of will and courage that he was able to pull himself together.
example.tran: 他全凭超凡的决心和勇气才使自己振作起来。

entry.def: If you say that something is worth the effort, you mean that it will justify the energy that you have spent or will spend on it.

example.ex: Fortunately, the chore of leaf sweeping is well worth the effort.
example.tran: 幸运的是，干清扫落叶这个活儿是值得的。

means.word_mean: 1. earnest and conscientious activity intended to do or accomplish something;

sentences.sentence: "made an effort to cover all the reading material"

means.word_mean: 2. use of physical or mental energy; hard work;
3. a series of actions advancing a principle or tending toward a particular end;

sentences.sentence: "they worked in the cause of world peace"
"the team was ready for a drive toward the pennant"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from French, from Old French esforcier, based on Latin ex- 'out' + fortis 'strong'

Sentence.sentence: That's what—six to eight hundred pounds! So this time I'll need to make a lot more effort and hopefully will be successful the first time.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月四级真题（第一套）听力 Section B
